citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A female Cocker Spaniel, tag #156, was observed with a heavy accumulation of plaque and tartar on both the upper and
lower teeth. The gums above some of the upper teeth were reddened and inflamed.
A female Poodle, tag #143, was observed with a heavy accumulation of plaque and tartar on both the upper and lower
teeth. The gums are reddened and inflamed. This dog also has issues with both ears. The ear canals are reddened and
inflamed with a dark brown dishcharge from both ears.
These conditions can be painful, lead to other systemic heath related issues and be a sign of a medical condition that
requires veterinary care.
The licensee must have these dogs evaluated by a veterinarian.
The licensee must establish and maintain an adequate program of veterinary care that includes the use of appropriate
methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries at all times.
To be corrected by: 8 Mar 24

There were at least 2 dogs that did not have any form of identification. Proper identification is necessary so the dog
identity is know for certain. The licensee must provide these dogs with a form of identification and ensure that all adult
dogs have an official form of identification at all times.
To be corrected by: 11 Mar 24
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A female Cocker Spaniel, tag #156, was observed with a heavy accumulation of plaque and tartar on both the upper and 
lower teeth. The gums above some of the upper teeth were reddened and inflamed.  
A female Poodle, tag #143, was observed with a heavy accumulation of plaque and tartar on both the upper and lower 
teeth. The gums are reddened and inflamed. This dog also has issues with both ears. The ear canals are reddened and 
inflamed with a dark brown dishcharge from both ears.  
These conditions can be painful, lead to other systemic heath related issues and be a sign of a medical condition that 
requires veterinary care.  
The licensee must have these dogs evaluated by a veterinarian. 
The licensee must establish and maintain an adequate program of veterinary care that includes the use of appropriate 
methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries at all times.  
To be corrected by: 8 Mar 24 
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
There were at least 2 dogs that did not have any form of identification. Proper identification is necessary so the dog 
identity is know for certain. The licensee must provide these dogs with a form of identification and ensure that all adult 
dogs have an official form of identification at all times. 
To be corrected by: 11 Mar 24 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with licensee. 
 
 n
